title: My Awesome Book
text:
Preface
This is a Quarto book.
To learn more about Quarto books visit https://quarto.org/docs/books.

title: 1  Introduction
text:
This is a book created from markdown and executable code.
See Knuth (1984) for additional discussion of literate programming.

2 .Python
Using {.python}: this is not-executable code, just useful for showing code with color.
Direct code:
print('Hola mundo!')
From file:
def mi_funcion(n):
    print("Hola"*n)

mi_funcion(3)


3 Python
Using {python}: this is useful to executing code when rendering the book. You can control how to show the code and outputs.
Direct code:

print('Hola mundo!')

Hola mundo!


From file:

def mi_funcion(n):
    print("Hola"*n)

mi_funcion(3)

HolaHolaHola




4 Pyodide
Pyodide-enabled code cell, using {pyodide-python}: This allows for completely executable code - the user can modify the code and execute it!
Direct code:

Please enable JavaScript to experience the dynamic code cell content on this page.
From file:

Please enable JavaScript to experience the dynamic code cell content on this page.




Knuth, Donald E. 1984. “Literate Programming.” Comput. J. 27 (2): 97–111. https://doi.org/10.1093/comjnl/27.2.97.

title: 2  Summary
text: In summary, this book has no content whatsoever.

title: References
text:
Knuth, Donald E. 1984. “Literate Programming.” Comput.
J. 27 (2): 97–111. https://doi.org/10.1093/comjnl/27.2.97.
